newsitem.title: JAPAN: M'bishi Materials to compensate miners for illness.
newsitem.headline: M'bishi Materials to compensate miners for illness.

text.p: Mitsubishi Materials Corp said on Tuesday that it and three of its subsidiaries would pay a total of about 1.5 billion yen to former miners and bereaved families as compensation for chronic lung disease.

The companies have been involved since May 1992 in legal battles over the issue of responsibility regarding lung disease contracted by workers in a mine owned by Mitsubishi Materials in northern Japan.
In one case concerning health and safety measures, the Sendai District Court ordered the companies in March to pay the plaintiffs 396 million yen in compensation, news reports said.

Mitsubishi Materials said it would post an extraordinary loss for the compensation payment in its results for the first half of the 1996/97 business year. Its half-year earnings results are due next month.
Nevertheless, the compensation payment should not have a significant impact on its profits, whether on a net, parent or consolidated basis, a company spokesman said.
